snippet: After months of defying federal regulators, Takata, the Japanese airbag supplier, agreed to issue a sweeping, nationwide recall.
abstract: Japanese auto supplier Takata agrees to sweeping recall after months of defying National Highway Traffic Safety Administration; officials say recall could affect estimated 34 million vehicles across country and take years to complete.
lead_paragraph: After months of defying federal regulators, Takata, the Japanese airbag supplier, agreed to issue a sweeping, nationwide recall.

headline.main: Takata Airbag Recall’s Huge Scale Could Delay Repairs
headline.print_headline: Recall’s Huge Scale Could Delay Repairs
